channel.title: How to portforward with a netgear router
channel.description:
ok i have seens threads asking and im no good at tuts so here goes...
1: open 2 internet explorers(or firefox) windows in 1 put in www.cmyip.com and coppy the ip
2: in the second window on the url bar at the top put in that ip you got from www.cmyip.com
3: if theres a password defult is username/email: admin password: password
4: go to services. click add custom service and it should come up with this. name: put moparscape type: tcp(maby udp dont thing it matters) start port (43594) end port: (43594).
5: now go to firewall rules. skip this if yours doesnt have it. click inbound exceptions and the service should auto-select your service name and port from step
4. in action put always allow and ignoor everything else. click apply. now click logout at the bottem left and it should be all done.
if anyone has any problems or suggestions post them here.

ok i have seens threads asking and im no good at tuts so here goesâ€¦

1: open 2 internet explorers(or firefox) windows
in 1 put in www.cmyip.com and coppy the ip

2: in the second window on the url bar at the top put in that ip you got from www.cmyip.com

3: if theres a password defult is username/email: admin password: password

4: go to services. click add custom service and it should come up with this. name: put moparscape type: tcp(maby udp dont thing it matters) start port (43594) end port: (43594).

5: now go to firewall rules. skip this if yours doesnt have it. click inbound exceptions and the service should auto-select your service name and port from step

  1. in action put always allow and ignoor everything else. click apply. now click logout at the bottem left and it should be all done.
